title: Inis Ocular
text:
Inis Ocular

Pronounced: Inn-ish Awk-you-lar
Etymology: Inis is island in irish, ocular is related to eyes
Location:
Importance: Trade port for the realm to other realms across the sea. Trade only occurs here to quarantine merchants from other realms.

Inis Ocular is known for its observatory and has been taken over by the “Emerald lights” religion. They use the observatory to try to look out for the emerald lights in the sky. The leader is Mentha the Mint (they/them).
The official ruler, The Shield Knight, lives in a small garden house in the hallowed garden. Here, grows the alien flower, Trillium Blaschkanum (Blaschka known for the glass flowers). Each flower is spit into three from the stem to the head. Each third has one triangular petal and various triangular leaves. The thirds are connected by thin fibres. All of it looks quite glass-like and one third is coloured emerald, another third a dark iridescent, and the third a yellow colour. The leaves are fed to silk moth larvae producing green, black, or yellow silk depending on the leaves they eat. The silks possibly have other effects.
The Shield Knight is blackmailed by mehta the Mint to let the Emerald lights rule. This is because they have evidence of The Shield Knight skimming wealth off the top from the trade that passes through.
Additionally, there are a lot of leather workers as lots of leather is received from other realms through trade.
Used Prompts Holding features Sage’s Den Bailey includes Hallowed garden Keep holds observatory Food is wet pie Goods are abundant leather Luxuries are esoteric silk Drama involves coup through blackmail Woe is unseen fire News of tournament mood content

title: Fabriknock
text:
Pronounced: Fa-bree-knock
Etymology: Fabir is old french for forge, knock is irish for hill
Location: R5-C12
Importance: Primary source of forged metals in the realm



Constant hammering rings through the bailey. It originates from the blacksmiths in a large white chimney like building. A thick deep purple metal rod runs far into the earth providing a mighty heat.
Many blacksmiths work here due to the free heat. Aside from the source of heat there is nothing else special about the forge and its output.



To match the blacksmiths many rivalling workshops exist in Fabriknock. They make all manner of contraptions and jewellery from the metals of the forge. They are especially fond of using the green pearls from the green bees.
The various wares are sold in market stalls surrounding the forge. The realm’s Merchants come here to buy these goods and then sell them at Inis Ocular.



Strange radial 3 petalled and 3 stemmed flowers exist in the surrounding area (Trillium Baumuum; trillium is a flower, Frank Baum wrote the wizard of oz). Although they are beautiful with their emerald petals and glass like appearance they are forbidden to be picked.
The flowers are used by the bee keepers. The bees that use its pollen produce a chartreuse honey that is sold as a luxury. Beehives are built into the wood walls of the town so the beekeepers can extract honey from inside the walls without walking on the flowers.
Additionally, bees end up growing a green emerald inside their body. These are extracted and used by the various makers in the workshops.



Inside the Keep of multi coloured rocks they keep a reliquary. This is the whole skeleton of the Green Eyed Seer. It is of high significance for the Emerald Lights religion who was seen as a sort of Demigod for their religion.
The skeleton looks like that of a “little grey man”. It is protected by The Leaf Knight. The Moat Knight sent it to be protected by The Leaf Knight as a power move against Salvia the Sage. The Leaf Knight is The Moat Knight’s child.



The denizens of the holding have fractured. There have been brawls and killings. It seems senseless to the guards and those in the Keep. But it is not senseless.
Many of the holding want to steal the skeleton of the Green Seer to give to The Eagle (myth). This seems to be turning into a new religion that worships the sun.
The other side follows the Emerald Lights religion and so do not want their reliquary to be given away.




Holding features bright forge
Bailey includes rustic workshops
Keep holds reliquary with bones
Food is chewy meat
Goods are fine honey
Luxuries are mythical jewel
Drama involves betrayal through brawl
Woe is ongoing killing
News of market nostalgic

title: Wandering Knights
text:
4-6
Sheriff of Klaegcasleen (they/them)
Mature
Helps both the repairers and reinforcement factions for favours
Explosives: Fire bird egg, explodes by touching the ground

The Mule Knight hides amongst the peasants, constantly gathering intel on Myths, Seers, and the Realm. They play all sides trying to act as a balancing force, knocking down the high and raising the low. Although effectively neutral they side more with The War Knight as The Mule Knight is kind and despises the The Ghoul Knight cruelty expressed through the kidnapping of The War Knight’s child.
The Mule Knight may show their androgynous youthful knightly presence to help other kind knights. They’ll only share info to those with stories to share, truth or fabrications are equally important to The Mule Knight.
Once a protege painter in the castle, The Mule Knight’s eyes are a lightish silver blue as all the lead accumulated in them. Although this stopped all other lead poisoning effects he became effectively blind and so he rarely leaves his horse. Unable to paint he found a heart he extracted from spores and tendrils and put into a jar he carries. This heart is the Green Seer who knighted The Mule Knight.







5-2
Envoy of Klaegcasleen (she/her)
Young
Reinforcement faction
Box of bones, painted wooden case, bones of unsorted chaos

A dark skinned woman with an afro. She wears a black and white hooded cloak with stylish but functional dress underneath.
Speaking with an erratic and boisterous voice she is very popular with the masses and so was given the role of envoy by The Ghoul Knight. This was also in part to the fact that she is the secret lover of The War Knight and so being envoy means she has to be away from Klaegcasleen regularly.
She is frequently away over the seas or through the realm to keep alliances and trade partners happy. There is a 50% chance she is at Klaegcasleen each month.
She is constantly trying to enrich the poorest and is afraid of being imprisoned or tied down.
Although not as great as other knights in mass battle she is great at assassinations and ambushing. She frequently tries to assassinate The Ghoul Knight but has never found a clean opportunity to do so.

title: Klaegcasleen Knights
text:
6-6
Head of the seat of power (he/him)
Old
Situated in Klaegcasleen
Head of Repairers faction
Bearded axe (d10 long) and dusty mail (A1)

The Ghoul Knight holds a wooden lion cub that they stole from The War Knight. This symbolises The War Knight’s child that The Ghoul Knight holds hostage.
The Ghoul Knight stands out even amongst Knights & Seers. His attire consists of various eclectic fabrics, styles, and colours. He speaks with a booming and passionate voice. However, his speeches are always cut short with violent coughing fits.
He is the ruler of the realm and his focus is on its security from internal and external threats. His de facto tactic is to demand obedience through fear. Easy with vassals but he knows other methods are needed with knights. Unfortunately, even he must honour the Seers.
Any chance he gets he will go fishing on the peninsula. He’ll always bring The War Knight’s child on these excursions.







1-6
Domain ruler at Klaegcasleen (she/her)
Mature
Leader of the reinforcement faction
Gear: Polearm (+d10 against beasts and monster) and long mail hood

The War Knight is a tall imposing figure in her armour. Fighting humans she is poised and will never strike those who have surrendered. Against beasts and monsters she will not stop till they or her are dead.
At court she wears her jade gambeson dress showing her flowing silver hair. However, her helm with her long mail hood is never far. She speaks with a flat voice to disguise her emotions. She deeply cares for the people of the realm and doesn’t agree with The Ghoul Knight.
The War Knight knows the ginger child that The Ghoul Knight holds hostage is not her real child. Her real child was stolen by The Burning Mother and so The War Knight’s child is “The Child” in the myth (43). Although she knows the myth hex location she does not go near, nor easily share the info, in case The Ghoul Knight interferes.
The War Knight wants the truth but is self bound by her knightly oath.







6-10
Steward of Klaegcasleen (he/him)
Mature
Repairer faction
Ancient scroll that references a body of water and an ancestor to them

A greedy and hungry man they talk with a weak and detached voice. They are either lost in their memories or dreaming. They pay little attention to others except The Ghoul Knight who they obey as their source of wealth and comfort.
Although they love what The Ghoul Knight provides, The Fanged Knight actually hates him and would be happy for someone else to lead. The Enthroned Seer has commanded The Fanged Knight to be the loyal steward of whoever leads the realm.
The Fanged Knight really wants to “fix” The Enthroned Seer to the form of a human. No idea how to do this but he hopes he can extract all the precious metals from the seer when it happens.







2-11
Klaegcasleen’s Marshal (she/her)
Young
Repairers faction
Sharp beastly sounding horn
Antler-halberd, d8, +d10 vs horned or antlered opponents

A short woman with a gravelly relaxed voice. Wielding an antler halberd and wild horn this rusty haired woman wears a red tunic and blue trousers.
She was raised by a family of giant talking badgers. This led to her using fierce intimidation to maintain what she considered her territory.
Her quarters are in the caverns below the castle. Here she raises otters as a family to replace her badger family. She frequently takes them out to hunt and they will come to her when she blows her horn.
She is missing her pinky and ring finger on her left hand. Bitten off by the wolves that killed her family. She forces the guards to wear antlered helmets so she can easily beat them with her antler-halberd.

title: Other holding Knights
text:
3-4
Ruler of Bochordil (they/them)
Old
Parent of The Leaf Knight

A weathered individual covered in intricate tattoos of a plethora of languages over their arms, legs and head. Although they have a cynical eye they speak with a soothing poetic voice when not whispering to their apprentice (The Rune Knight) who speaks on their behalf most of the time. They very much treat their apprentice as a proud but stern parent would.
They are a human of science and facts. They despise Dewyn the Sage who stops the proper investigation into the “Temple”. They want to break the vassals so the religion can be stopped. They find this incredibly difficult to do as the religious are so irrational so rational plans seldom seem to work.
The Moat Knight grew up as part of The Itinerant Realm. Constantly travelling they value friendship over places. However, they stay here as the same realm (The Eminent Realm) who destroyed his family’s realm is now trying to invade their new realm. The Moat Knight grew up with The Shield Knight and they are lovers and regularly write to each other.







4-1
Apprentice scholar at Bochordil (she/her)
Young
Crystal flask: If shaken gives of a gentle light, If smashed the next season arrives

The Rune Knight is a tall woman wearing a deep purple dress covered in runes of metallic thread. She speaks with a poetic whisper matching her cautious nature. She sees herself as a peacemaker and bridge between the knights and The Emerald Lights. Though she has currently made little ground.
She has been raised kindly by The Moat Knight and The Shield Knight. Her parents, previously knights, were executed by the Ghoul Knight. The stated reason was treason but was actually due to personal conflict with her parents and The Ghoul Knight. This has caused The Rune Knight to become a people pleaser and try to stay out of sight by escaping into the books at Bochordil.
The Rune Knight sees The Leaf Knight as her sister but gives her space since The Leaf Knight seems to hate her.







6-3
Ruler of Fabriknock (she/her)
Young
Daughter of The Moat Knight and The Shield Knight
Useful stick: terrifies snake, eels, and worms but only works in bright sunlight

A young but wary knight. She does not know who to trust and so is very hesitant to make decisions based on information given by others. This along with their relaxed attitude irritates their subjects. They are often found sitting in the forge reading books, the loud noise stopping others from talking to her.
The Leaf Knight is the child of The Moat Knight they studied at Bochordil. They hate The Rune Knight as The Moat Knight treats The Rune Knight like their child. The Leaf Knight was pampered at Bochordil but now they have to work hard as the ruler. They wish they could go back to studying books.
However, they are quite lively these days as weird goings on with killings are happening in their holding. This allows them to investigate.







2-8
“Ruler” of Inis Ocular (she/her)
Old
Mother of The Rune Knight
Soothing salve: aroma of meat, side effect of lethargy

The Shield Knight is a weathered old woman wearing crude dresses. She only wears dresses from her lost realm, emblazoned with parallel lines that connect, representing the circular path of their previous nomadic life. This is the same realm The Moat Knight came from, The Itinerant Realm.
Her voice is strong and terse yet her writing voice is sweet and gentle. She regularly writes to her lover (The Moat Knight) and their daughter (The Leaf Knight). Although she knows The Leaf Knight hates The Rune Knight she is an adoring ally of The Rune Knight. Nothing would make her happier than seeing those two acting like loving sisters rather than fighting sisters.
Above all The Shield Knight wishes for the “Temple” at Bochordil to be destroyed. Maybe then The Moat Knight would pay more attention to her and it would really stick it to the Emerald Lights.

title: The Emerald Lights
text:
A religion that existed when these lands where still part of the Eminent Realm. They praise the three emerald stars that lie at the very top of the night sky. They know these as “The Emerald Eyes” as they watch the lands, never moving with the other stars.
The religion believes the deep purple metal structures through the lands are gifts from the Emerald Eyes. These are indeed from the Emerald Eyes but not as gifts. The Emerald Eyes are in fact from The Star Myth (3-4).
Structures include:

The Gates at Bochordil
The Pyramid at Bochordil
The Forge rod at Fabriknock

The religion is controlled by three main leaders, the Triad.



One of the Triad (they/them)
Based in Inis Ocular





One of the Triad (he/him)
Based in Bochordil
Wields a deep purple sceptre ending in 3 prongs holding an orb shaped emerald.





One of te Triad (she/her)
Based in Klaegcasleen





Local leader at Fabriknock (he/him)

title: First age
text:
The Ghoul Knight forms the Excised realm



The Lands were part of The Eminent Realm
The Eminent Realm started an age long war with The Itinerant Realm
The Itinerant Realm were a nomadic realm The Moat Knight and The Shield Knight come from.
The Eminent Realm destroyed the Itinerant Realm
However, this weakened the realm who were attacked by other realms.
This caused the south part bordering the seas to become separated from the Eminent Realm.
The Ghoul Knight along with other Knights took this opportunity to take over this part of the realm as their new realm, The Excised Realm.
They could not do this alone and teamed up with the Emerald Lights religion who had gathered support from the masses as a “peaceful” religious group who accepted refugees from The Itinerant Realm.
As part of this partnership The Ghoul Knight agreed that no Knights could hold a position of power in the church. Unfortunately for the church only Knights are allowed to hold positions of power in the seat of power.
Over time all the other knights that followed The Ghoul Knight from the Eminent Realm have been executed by him.

title: Bochordil
text:
Pronounced: Back-or-dill
Etymology: Bochord is old english for library, aill is irish for cliff
Location: R1-C5
Importance: Library and protection from invaders from the north (The Eminent Realm)

The Tower of Bochordil is roughly cut out of the cliff face of a crag. It is easy to miss if you don’t know its location.


The bailey of Bochordil fits in a perfectly cylindrical cut out of the crag. T he cut out runs from the top of the crag to a perfectly level circle on the ground. No one knows how this occurred but many people believe it was through divine intervention.



The holding’s base is not quite a perfect circle with the imperfection caused by the space that allows escape from the holding. There lies a two doored gate, as tall as three men and as thick as a mule from nose to tail. It is made from a__deep purple metal__ only occasionally found in rocks that have dropped from the heavens and other mysterious structures. Atop the gate there are always guards wary of invasion from the north.



In the centre of the Bailey lies a tall but thin triangular based pyramid. Made of the same deep purple metal as the gate it is seen as a divine gift. It is used as a church for the Emerald Lights. The religious leader of this holding is Salvia the Sage.



The Tower of Bochordil is known as The Transposed Tower. Rather than the tower being a cylindrical structure with empty space around it, the tower’s rooms are carved into the rock surrounding the empty space of the cylindrical bailey. The Transposed Tower’s windows looking over the bailey and its dominating temple.
There are various floors filled with books and scholars. There is only one door for entry from the bailey that leads directly into the throne room.
In the throne room lies a throne that would be called plain if it were not made entirely out of emerald. The walls of the room itself are plastered with large pages depicting maps, treaties, and stories.
Sitting upon the throne is The Moat Knight, always reading and writing even when speaking or listening to others. Always at their service is their apprentice The Rune Knight, managing the tactical affairs as The Moat Knight manages the strategic.
The Mule Knight studied at The Transposed Tower and has strong connections with the Knights and scholars there.
Only The Moat Knight, The Rune Knight, or Salvia the Sage can grant access to the library of the Tower.



Unfortunately their location’s geography does not promote food production and so they mostly rely on fermented fish from the fishing in the south east peninsula. The denizens set up the holding as a brilliant choke point to repel the constant invasions of The Eminent Realm who would use it as a perfect staging ground for a war with The Excised Realm. People stay for the accumulated knowledge or the holy structure.



There are spies of other realms in The Transposed Tower. The Moat Knight and The Rune Knight know this. They have their own spies bribe them with their knowledge to share knowledge of the other realms.
Most importantly the spies/scholars of The Transposed Tower are able to make an intoxicating mead that is made nowhere else. After drinking the mead you have lucid dreams that you remember with utmost clarity. Unfortunately you forget everything you did whilst you were drunk and are very likely to answer all questions truthfully.
This is made with normal bees that use the pollen from a flower that came from the heavens.



The bees and flowers are cultivated at the top of the crag.
The bee’s royal jelly is also used to create a flawless floral perfume that is used to trade with other realms.
The flower is called Trillium Wellsii (H.G Wells wrote War of the Worlds). It has three curling stems that connect to one head with 3 petals. The Petals are a deep dark iridescent colour and on closer inspection look almost glass like.

title: Holdings
text:
Holdings
Holdings are the larger centres of civilisation in the realm.
There are four in this realm:

title: Klaegcasleen
text:
Pronounced: Kla-cleen
Etymology: Claeg is old english for clay, Caislean is irish for castle
Location: R8-C8
Importance: Holds the seat of power

Atop a steep hill of red clay smothered in rusted clovers proudly sits Klaegcasleen, the seat of power.


A massive oval based cylindrical citadel sits within the dwelling’s walls. From afar the settlement blends into the sky due to the teal coloured bricks that make up the walls and citadel. These building blocks of clay are incredibly strong and cause the internal temperature of the castle to stay at a splendid cool temperature all year round. This is enjoyed by all locals and visitors.
The ground hall of the citadel is dominated by a great hall. This is a public space used for various events such as feasts, theatre, workshops, lectures and more. Some say this is pure generosity, others say this is to prevent unseen assassinations.



Although the foundation seems to be a clay hill it is actually on top of a limestone outcropping of caves, the clay sides installed and maintained during periods without war. Apart from shelter the citizens also make use of the caves’ water. A hallowed fountain sits prominently as the centre piece of the Bailey. The site was chosen due to its inexplicable existence.
The fountain’s water never stops flowing and many say it will outlive even the realm. Little is known about the marble fountain’s origins with its carved imagery of fairies and pond weeds indicating it belonged to a long forgotten time. The townspeople treasure it as they use the impossibly pure and clear water for pottery and paint making.



There are many potters, creating all sorts of ceramics such as bricks, tableware, and vases. The pottery is known for its strength and simple beauty. However, a rift amongst the potters has recently occurred.
Where once only blue clay was used, now new artists are using red clay.

The Gaulters believe the blue clay is calming and that the red clay should be left for the land, so life can grow on it.
The Rusthands say that blue clay is now hard to find and therefore too expensive, preventing new potters from starting their craft.




The citadel boasts amazing paintings of people. All across the realms the paintings are praised and coveted for the life likeness of its subjects. Unfortunately this is due to their use of minimum (red lead) that leads to lead poisoning in the preparers and artists.
Chronic poisoning displays as agitation, irritability, vision disorders, hypertension, and a grayish facial hue. Older skilled painters are kept on the 1st floor of the citadel where they only use blue candles to light the rooms (hiding their grey facial hues). They only paint in the sun room, believing sunlight is the best light for skin.



Due to the location on a peninsula the dwelling is able to trade with other realms via the sea. Currently there is much jubilation about spiced cakes. Otherwise they eat various plant foods and seafood.



Unfortunately the holding is always hit with a massive storm, known as brickfall, at the start of Tithe. The citizens hide in the caves until the 2 day storm passes at which much damage will have occurred to the wooden homes due to various bricks from the wall and citadel falling on them. Overall the walls provide more safety as a windshield than destruction but many believe not enough is done to prevent bricks from falling.
This has led to 2 sides in the leaders of the dwelling who also act as the seat of power.
The Repairers faction believe things are best as they are. Anything to stop bricks from falling would require more effort than laying in the new bricks and fixing damages. They oppose the Reinforcement plans as it would ruin the simple beauty of Klaecasleen for Eldermass. It contains the following members:

The Ghoul Knight: Leader of the Seat of power
The Fanged Knight: Steward of Klaegcasleen
The Horn Knight: Marshal of Klaegcasleen

The Reinforcement faction believe red clay should be laid over the walls and castle to prevent brickfalls. Carrying this out during Eldermass would allow the clay to dry in the sun. Additionally, they propose artists to create more complex art through the reinforcing clay. This clay would then be washed away and added back to the land through the rains of the rest of the year. It contains the following members:

The War Knight: Domain ruler of Klaegcasleen
The Bone Knight: Envoy of the realm

There have been various assassination attempts on The Ghoul Knight and on The War Knight.

title: Fabriknock
text:
Constant hammering rings through the bailey. It originates from the blacksmiths in a large white chimney like building. A thick deep purple metal rod runs far into the earth providing a mighty heat.
Many blacksmiths work here due to the free heat. Aside from the source of heat there is nothing else special about the forge and its output.

title: Fabriknock
text:
To match the blacksmiths many rivalling workshops exist in Fabriknock. They make all manner of contraptions and jewellery from the metals of the forge. They are especially fond of using the green pearls from the green bees.
The various wares are sold in market stalls surrounding the forge. The realm’s Merchants come here to buy these goods and then sell them at Inis Ocular.

title: Fabriknock
text:
Strange radial 3 petalled and 3 stemmed flowers exist in the surrounding area (Trillium Baumuum; trillium is a flower, Frank Baum wrote the wizard of oz). Although they are beautiful with their emerald petals and glass like appearance they are forbidden to be picked.
The flowers are used by the bee keepers. The bees that use its pollen produce a chartreuse honey that is sold as a luxury. Beehives are built into the wood walls of the town so the beekeepers can extract honey from inside the walls without walking on the flowers.
Additionally, bees end up growing a green emerald inside their body. These are extracted and used by the various makers in the workshops.

title: Fabriknock
text:
Inside the Keep of multi coloured rocks they keep a reliquary. This is the whole skeleton of the Green Eyed Seer. It is of high significance for the Emerald Lights religion who was seen as a sort of Demigod for their religion.
The skeleton looks like that of a “little grey man”. It is protected by The Leaf Knight. The Moat Knight sent it to be protected by The Leaf Knight as a power move against Salvia the Sage. The Leaf Knight is The Moat Knight’s child.

title: Fabriknock
text:
The denizens of the holding have fractured. There have been brawls and killings. It seems senseless to the guards and those in the Keep. But it is not senseless.
Many of the holding want to steal the skeleton of the Green Seer to give to The Eagle (myth). This seems to be turning into a new religion that worships the sun.
The other side follows the Emerald Lights religion and so do not want their reliquary to be given away.
